body.name: OsoCozy Organic Flannel Cloth Baby Wipes - Reusable & Washable Saves Money. 100% Unbleached Organic Cotton. Colorful Stitching. 9 x 9 Inches Each and 12 Per Package
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 12 hrs 41 mins
features: SOFT AND GENTLE ORGANIC FLANNEL BABY WIPES – Feel the softness of these OsoCozy baby wipes that are made of 100% organic cotton flannel so they will always feel smooth on your baby’s delicate skin.

SAVE MONEY WITH ORGANIC FLANNEL REUSABLE WIPES – Good for the environment and your wallet, our wipes are a cost-effective alternative to disposable wipes and are gentle on skin and easy to clean. Sold either 12 in 1 pack or 36 in 3 packs.
100% GOTS certified organic cotton. 9 by 9 inches prior to washing, shrinks to approximately 8 by 8 inches. Wash before using, clip any loose threads.
EASY TO WASH BABY WIPES – Our flannel wipes are easy to wash with your cloth diapers or your regular laundry. The single-layer fabric design is durable for long-lasting softness that dries quickly.
PORTABLE CLOTH BABY WIPES – Take our Flannel Baby Wipes with you in your purse or car for emergencies on the go, or use them as washcloths in the tub or for regular clean ups at home.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: OsoCozy Organic Flannel Baby Wipes (12 or 36 Count) OsoCozy Organic Flannel Baby Wipes - Luxurious organic flannelette baby wipes. Soft and absorbent and generously sized at 9 by 9 inches prior to washing. They have a single-layer fabric design that is durable for long-lasting softness that dries quickly. The reusable alternative to disposable baby wipes. Attractive and sustainable organic unbleached fabric with soft colored edging. Try our 36 Count offer for the best savings and to make sure you always have clean wipes available. Wash before using.

100% Organic Cotton The 100% organic cotton flannel provides lots of softness and absorbency. Washable The Osocozy Organic Flannel Baby Wipes are easy to wash with your other cloth baby products or your regular laundry. Reusable Our organic cloth flannel baby wipes are cost-effective and good for the environment unlike disposable wipes.

Other OsoCozy Cloth Diaper Wipes - See the OsoCozy brand store to purchase. OsoCozy Unbleached Flannel Baby Wipes (15 or 45 Count) Feel the softness of these unbleached flannel wipes. Same as our bleached wipes but unbleached ivory color.Single-layer fabric design that is durable for long-lasting softness that dries quickly.Beautifully surged with solid colored thread to make them an attractive addition to your diaper bag. Other OsoCozy Cloth Diaper Wipes - See the OsoCozy brand store to purchase. OsoCozy Terry Flannel Baby Wipes (12 Count) Made with a layer of soft terry velour sewn on a flannel backing.Extra absorbent, great for wiping baby's little hands and face.100% cotton 8 by 8 inches.Thicker than our very popular single layered flannel wipes. Made for those parents desiring something a little more substantial for wiping babies' behinds.These also make nice wash cloths. Available in Bleached (White) or Unbleached (Ivory). Multicolored surging stitching as pictured. Other OsoCozy Cloth Diaper Wipes - See the OsoCozy brand store to purchase. OsoCozy Bleached (White) Flannel Baby Wipes (15 or 45 Count) Feel the softness of these bleached flannel wipes. Same as our unbleached wipes but bleached white color.Single-layer fabric design that is durable for long-lasting softness that dries quickly.Beautifully surged with solid colored thread to make them an attractive addition to your diaper bag. Other OsoCozy Cloth Diaper Wipes - See the OsoCozy brand store to purchase. OsoCozy Bamboo Blend Terry Baby Wipes (8 Count) Soft and absorbent French terry baby wipes.Made from our blend of 56% Viscose Rayon from Bamboo, 24% cotton and 20% polyester. This blend makes for a better washing more durable wipe than wipes made of 80-100% viscose.Soft natural ivory fabric color. Versatile as both a wash cloth and a baby wipe. Suitable for any kind of baby mess from faces to tooshies.

WHY USE CLOTH Even when the economy is humming, families look for ways to save money with a new baby. Now more than ever, it is time to cut costs wherever we can. When you can cut costs and use a superior product, even better! Did you know that using cloth, not only in wipes but with diapers can reduce your costs by more than 3 times. Additionally, if you have more than one child your savings are multiplied as many of your cloth products will not wear out with your first little one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Zero Waste Option
reviews.reviewText: I bought multiple packs of these wipes for my baby. I wanted an affordable and zero waste alternative to traditional baby wipes so I purchased these and I love them! They are SO soft and get the job done. My son is breastfed and only 4 weeks old so we have A LOT of diaper changes; I keep these wet and in a warmer and they seem much more gentle on his sensitive skin. Even starting out wet they soak up any mid change “accidents” (you know what happens when you change a baby boy!). I have also used them dry with a squeeze bottle and they absorb all excess water well. I highly recommend these wipes!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to Use
reviews.reviewText: I haven’t used it yet…but they appear soft, easy to use, and durable. I appreciated how quickly I received it, and it was also packaged well. Thank you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality and price
reviews.reviewText: Best wipe for the price, and I tried several! Durable, very soft and get even softer with washing-yet get baby's bum clean! Happy to know they are organic too. No problems with the seams coming undone like other brands (that were the same price or more). LOVE THESE and I've been using daily and washing tons for over a month with no problems.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Way better than irritating plastic single use baby wipes
reviews.reviewText: I ordered one pack of these when my baby was born a year and a half ago. We have used them every day and washed in the machine and put them in the dryer. Not one of them has unraveled. But just like with other cotton products like his diapers you have to wash them and dry them three to five times before use because cotton has a natural anti water absorption coating on it and these are unbleached organic cotton. After a few washes they are amazingly absorbent and I use a squirt bottle that has a few drops of lavender in it to wet them that's on our changing table. The Disposable wipees are made of plastic and are terrible for the environment to be using them once and then throwing them away. These are great because there is zero waste and we throw them in the washing machine and they come out really clean. They would also dry very quickly if you were hanging laundry to dry. We absolutely love this zero waste option for baby wipes. We just ordered another pack for him to take to preschool for hand wipes instead of sending him with those awful chemical wipes they ask you to take with them. We'll just include them in a wet dry bag and one section will be for clean wipes and one section will be for used wet wipes. I highly recommend these to any one with a infant we use them from day one and we will continue to use these and will relive their life as rags once we're done using them for the baby.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent cloth wipes
reviews.reviewText: These wipes are pretty good. Love that they're organic, and they are very soft. We dampen them with water, use them, and throw them in the wet bag for washing. The edging does tend to run / lots of threads after just a few washings, but the wipe itself seems to be holding up fine. We have an old-fashioned top loader, not sure whether they would hold up better in an HE machine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2019
reviews.reviewText: so soft, holding up well after washings so far, and super cute stacked on baby table. I use them for baths and wipes, they are not super absorbent but I can't imagine why you would need them to be.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Lower quality than expected
reviews.reviewText: The wipes are super soft and I’m sure they will work well but there were a couple of defective ones out of the 2 packs I ordered. Not sure how well they are going to hold up

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2022
reviews.reviewText: It is soft, absorbent and it does the job!
